DOC.detailed_description: Early diagnostic non ST elevation coronary syndrome ( ACS ) patient admitted emergency room difficult . Two news biochemical marker assess study suggest heart fatty bind protein ischemia modify albumin early marker myocardial necrosis myocardial ischemia . Study objective : The aim study analyse predictive value association heart fatty bind protein ischemia modify albumin non ST segment elevation ACS diagnosis first hour management emergency room . Methods : In prospective double blind study , initial heart fatty bind protein ischemia modify albumin level measure consecutive patient admitted emergency room chest pain suspect non-ST elevation ACS . Data include history , physical examination , serial 12-lead ECG troponin-I measurement 0 6 hour admission collect treat physician blind result marker . Based hospital diagnosis algorithm ( troponin repeat measurement , treadmill test ischemia detection , coronarography necessary ) follow-up one month , patient classify non-ST elevation ACS two independent physician blind result marker . Sensitivity , specificity , positive negative predictive value determine marker combine analysis .
DOC.criteria: All consecutive patient admitted emergency room primary complaint chest pain evolve within 12 hour suspect acute coronary syndrome patient young 18 year old , ST elevation 12lead ECG , evident traumatic cause chest pain severe communication problem
